decks.notes: This deck focuses on utilizing Phelia, Exuberant Shepherd as the commander to create a fast-paced aggro strategy in a Duel Commander 1 vs 1 format. The key strategy is to deploy a variety of creatures and equipment to quickly overwhelm the opponent with efficient and powerful attacks. Cards like Palace Jailer, Skyclave Apparition, and Elite Spellbinder help control the board while creatures like Blade Splicer, Stoneforge Mystic, and Seasoned Dungeoneer provide additional value and threats. The deck also includes disruptive elements like Thalia, Guardian of Thraben and Containment Priest to disrupt the opponent's game plan. Overall, this deck aims to be proactive and aggressive to quickly secure a victory.

The deck revolves around deploying aggressive creatures and supporting them with equipment and removal spells to control the board. The commander, Cloud, Midgar Mercenary, enhances the aggro strategy by providing additional value and flexibility in combat. The deck includes a mix of powerful creatures like Puresteel Paladin and Skyclave Apparition, along with versatile cards like Swords to Plowshares and Stoneforge Mystic to deal with threats efficiently. The deck also features a strong equipment package with cards like Umezawa's Jitte and Sword of Feast and Famine to boost the creatures' effectiveness in combat. Overall, the key concept of the deck is to apply early pressure, disrupt opponents' game plans, and maintain board presence to secure victory in the 1 vs 1 format of Duel Commander.

The key focus of this deck is to utilize Aang, Swift Savior as the Commander to create a fast-paced Aggro strategy in a Duel Commander format. The deck includes a mix of control elements such as counterspells like Force of Negation and Mana Leak, alongside removal spells like Swords to Plowshares and Skyclave Apparition. It also includes creatures with disruptive abilities like Drannith Magistrate and True-Name Nemesis to disrupt the opponent's game plan. The deck aims to apply pressure early on with efficient creatures like Vendilion Clique and Restless Anchorage, while also having the ability to protect its game plan with cards like Teferi, Time Raveler and Brazen Borrower.

The deck revolves around using Cloud, Midgar Mercenary as the commander to lead an aggressive strategy focused on quickly overwhelming the opponent. The deck includes a mix of powerful aggression tools like Swords to Plowshares, Skyclave Apparition, and Sword of Feast and Famine, as well as protection and disruption cards like Mother of Runes, Giver of Runes, and Mana Tithe. The deck also includes strong utility lands like Eiganjo Castle and Flagstones of Trokair to support its aggressive game plan. By combining efficient threats with protection and disruption, the deck aims to apply constant pressure on the opponent and control the battlefield to secure victory in the 1 vs 1 Duel Commander format.

The deck focuses on controlling the game with counterspells and removal while also utilizing Aang's abilities to tempo opponents out of the game. The deck aims to disrupt the opponent's plans while slowly chipping away at their life total with evasive creatures like Vendilion Clique and Restoration Angel. By efficiently managing resources and making the most out of instant-speed interaction, the deck looks to outmaneuver opponents and capitalize on any opening to secure victory. A strong mix of card draw, disruption, and threats gives the deck a versatile game plan that can adapt to different matchups and strategies, making it a formidable force in the 1 vs 1 format.

The deck focuses on controlling the game through counterspells, removal, and disruptive cards while utilizing Atraxa's abilities to support this strategy. The deck aims to slow down opponents' game plans, protect its own threats, and generate card advantage through cards like Brainstorm, Mystic Sanctuary, and Teferi, Hero of Dominaria. It also includes a variety of versatile spells like Supreme Verdict and Abrupt Decay to deal with different types of threats. The mana base is carefully constructed to ensure smooth color fixing and maximize the deck's potential. Overall, the deck aims to out-value and outlast opponents by maintaining control of the game and steadily progressing towards victory.

This deck focuses on using Azusa's ability to play multiple lands per turn to ramp quickly and generate a large amount of mana. The deck includes a variety of land-related cards such as Primeval Titan, Courser of Kruphix, and Uro's Saga to maximize landfall triggers and generate additional value. The deck also includes control elements such as Maze of Ith, Oblivion Stone, and Trinisphere to disrupt opponents' strategies and protect Azusa. With cards like Ugin, the Spirit Dragon and Emrakul, the Promised End as win conditions, the deck aims to outvalue opponents by overwhelming them with resources and powerful threats. By efficiently ramping and controlling the game, the deck aims to dominate the battlefield and secure victory.

The main strategy of this deck is to control the game by disrupting the opponent's plans with a variety of counter spells, removal spells, and discard spells. Glarb, Calamity's Augur serves as the commander, providing card advantage and potential win conditions. The deck includes a mix of efficient removal like Abrupt Decay and Fatal Push, along with powerful counter spells like Cryptic Command and Force of Negation. Card advantage is gained through cards like Snapcaster Mage and Tamiyo, Inquisitive Student, allowing for consistent answers to threats. The deck aims to outlast the opponent through attrition and eventually win the game through strategic plays and powerful finishers like Jace, Wielder of Mysteries.
